channel.title: Welcome on The Programmer's Ephemeris
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome on The Programmer's Ephemeris

item.title: String.Format
item.description: The String object in the C# language exposes a method for string formatting that is very easy to use. The most common use case of the string.Format method is for passing a string representing the desired format as the first argument, and an array of objects to insert into the string. The parameter indicators in the format string are 0 based indexes. The first parameter is {0}, the second is {1}, etc.
